actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce

official_title: To recognize the achievements of radio amateurs, and to establish support for such amateurs as national policy.

summary.text: Commends radio amateurs for their contributions to technical progress in electronics and for their emergency radio communications in times of disaster. Urges the Federal Communications Commission to continue and enhance the development of the amateur radio service as a public benefit by adopting rules and regulations which encourage the use of new technologies within the amateur radio service. Declares that reasonable accommodation should be made for effective operation of amateur radio from residences, private vehicles, and public areas and that regulation at all levels of government should facilitate and encourage amateur radio operation as a public benefit.

titles.title: To recognize the achievements of radio amateurs, and to establish support for such amateurs as national policy.
